newsitem.title: GHANA: Ghana shares drift lower in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Ghana shares drift lower in thin trade.

text.p: Shares on the Ghana Stock Exchange extended earlier losses on Wednesday as economic worries and pre-election jitters continued to dampen demand for blue chips.

The All-Share Index ended 0.12 points lower at 365.77 from the previous 365.89 points close. The broader market remained very quiet with one gainer and two decliners on a thin volume of 5,000 shares traded, a further slump from Monday's 5,030 shares.
Dealers predicted the situation would persist for sometime because of the absence of offshore and institutional buyers.
Investors have adopted a wait-and-see attitude in the runup to presidential and parliamentary elections on December 7.
Home Finance Co was the lone gainer, adding one cedi to close at 128 cedis while Kumasi Brewery Ltd dipped five cedis to finish at 645 cedis and Unilever was down three cedis to 790 cedis.
